Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in applying the reasonableness standard to the RPD's decision
Application_Facts: Tamayo claimed refugee protection in Canada, alleging persecution in Cuba; her claim was rejected by the RPD and upheld by the RAD using a reasonableness standard
Decision_Outcome: The Federal Court allowed the judicial review application
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the RAD's decision
Court_Ruling: The Federal Court found that the RAD erred in its approach and did not respect Tamayoâ€™s right to a formal appeal
Defendant_Behavior: RAD upheld RPD's decision by applying an incorrect standard of review
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard vs. de novo appeal
Assessment_Factor: Correct standard of review applicable to RAD's analysis
Procedural_Issue: RAD failed to conduct an independent de novo review as required
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard (incorrectly applied); correct standard is de novo
Evidence_Used: Evidence submitted in support of refugee claim regarding conditions in Cuba and personal risk
Application_Basis: Right to a formal appeal before the RAD
Evidence_Assessed: All evidence related to Tamayo's refugee claim and country conditions in Cuba
Relief_Sought: Allowance of judicial review and remittal of the matter for proper assessment
Governing_Rule: RAD must conduct an independent analysis and either confirm or set aside the RPD's decision
Outcome: Federal Court allowed the application for judicial review
Decisional_Body: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD), Federal Court
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in country of origin (Cuba)
Cause_Description: Tamayo claimed refugee protection due to fear of persecution in Cuba based on political opinion or association
Evidence_Handling: RAD failed to independently assess the evidence, instead deferring to RPD under reasonableness standard
Evidence_Issues: Failure by RAD to re-evaluate evidence independently
Evidence_Assessment: RAD did not properly reassess the evidence in a de novo manner
Decision_Rationale: RAD is required to conduct a fresh review of the RPD decision, not merely assess its reasonableness
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of independent evaluation of evidence by RAD
